text: 375ml bottle from Cornelius. 2015 vintage. Pours clear golden orange, almost still, but with a thin ring of white head. Cider-sharp aromas, bread crusts and pear. Slight funk and sweat. Taste is light sour, light orange, faint acetic, rough pear cider vibe again. Lactic acid too. Complex sweet and sour tastes... not clashing exactly, but neither are they in perfect harmony. Still, an interesting beer.

The luierik or doesjel version of 3Fs Golden Blend, meaning a Golden Blend in which the spontaneous refermentation in the bottle moves forward too late and too slowly, resulting in an undercarbonated geuze and therefore not fulfilling the local consumers expectations of a traditional geuze (traditionally speaking, that is). Never noticed this one existed, honestly, must have confused it with the regular Doesjel, so I ordered it at 3Fs Lambik-O-Droom today, where it was obviously served as properly, carefully and professionally as one can imagine. Loose, bubbly head, requiring forcing to develop but settling into an irregular, snow white rim, eventually retaining quite well but not to the same degree as a succeeded geuze; hazy peach blonde robe with deep and warm orange hue. Aroma has a striking and unexpected, but very inviting tendency of freshly baked bread, refreshened by soft but very outspoken lemon rind, unripe yellow plum, raw rhubarb, dry sherry, wet wood, bread crumbs returning, vaguer hints of stale sweat, kimchi, wet wood, dusty old horse stable. Estery onset but seemingly a tad cleaner than the full-fledged version, lots of unripe stonefruit, unripe gooseberries, wry grape peel, hard pear and a touch of bitter oranges, evidently softly carbonated but not entirely flat like a straight lambic, feeling a bit vinous; bready basis but less so than expected based on the nose, wheaty breadiness too, supporting a long-stretched, drying lactic tartness and a thin but incentive lemony acidity, helping in thoroughly drying the palate. The estery fruitiness seems to become more explicit towards the finish with even a nectarine-like accent in the end, surrounded by Bretty funkiness (though again subduedly so), a lot of wet wood tannins and sherry-ish impressions. I know that the producers consider this type of undercarbonated and under-refermented geuzes a technical failure (and they are right), but this one is still in its very nature an intelligent and delicate blend of great lambics - granted that it hasnt reached the astonishing complexity of the eventual Golden Blend (which is physically the exact same beer), but it still boasts an impressive degree of complexity and personality and I for one thoroughly enjoyed it, especially considering its natural habitat in which I tasted it, of course.
Amazing bright citrus with a more noticeable acidity then Golden Blend. Backing funky minerality. Phenomenal.
UPDATED: JAN 18, 2017 From bottle (2013). Aroma of tart green plums and funk. Clear golden with no head. Taste is dry and moderate sour. Light body, dry feel and tart green fruit finish.

375ml bottle. (2013 vintage) Pours a clear orange-gold with a thin, short lived, fully dissipating, white head that leaves no lace. Aroma of horse blanket, brett, tart apples, lemon, grapefruit, apricot and oak. Sweet, acidic, fruity flavour of lemon, grapefruit, orange, green apple, white wine, brett, horse blanket, caramel and oak with a dry, sour finish. Light body with a watery to oily texture and flat carbonation. Very nice, lots of complexity.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

At Maakuns. Shared from 2013 bottle. Thanks bro! Hazy deep golden with no head. Intense white grapeskin, nutmeg, white wine, cerise, hyena balls, camel toe, apricot cheesecake, bookcase shelves, lipstick of your first kiss, swampy teenage armpit, sexy goat, virgins ballsack. Tres complex. Medium body, no carbonation, slick feel, daaaaaamn tasty. Only emoji can express the quality of this beer. 😱

Bottle shared. May 2013 vintage. Bit hazy deep orange golden with no head but some big bubbles on top and small bubbles clinging to the glass. Massive funk and hay, apricot, white pepper, pineapple, light cookie dough, some soft cheese, dank earthy notes and soft caramel. Under medium sweet, light sour and very light bitter. Medium bodied with very soft carbonation. Incredible aroma and taste. Crazy good.

(Bottle) Hazy, golden amber colour. Still, with some brief white bubbles. Fruity, sourish nose with notes of citrus, grapefruit, dried apricots, sour grapes, hay, barnyard and funky yeast. Fruity, tart taste with grapefruit, orange, dried apricots, hay, green apples, yeast and a dry and tart finish. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel. Dry. Solid and well made, the lack of carbonation makes it a touch smoother than the ordinary gueuze. Great beer.
2016-10-07 Sample from bottle @ Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival. Taste of apple cider, apple cores, flowers and mint.

375ml bottle at Pizzeria Paradiso-Alexandria on 7/14/15. Tulip. Hazy gold with small white head. Funky wet hay and tart citrus, grapefruit peel, yeast, grains. Really refreshing and well done, perfect for a summer afternoon.

2012 375mL bottle drunk 8/25/16.Large white head shows good carbonation atop a clear, bright flaxen-gold body.Soft oak tones intertwine deftly with plentiful brett fruitiness, as easygoing lactic notes enter the mix as well. Graceful aging, hints of honey-like malt and cream-of-wheat character deepen the elegance as well as providing a good backbone. Beautifully balanced, attractive nose eminently invites sniffing, with the brett expression just about as perfect as one can imagine, full of horse blanket, guava, lime, light band aid and leather. Bright and clean with no alcohol or flaw.Fantastic in the mouth, as expected, as well. Tight carbonation belies the name, as big bursts of juicy fruit and lip-smakcing sourness coat the palate. Great texture, with a nearly chewy, wheat-laden body that shows good dryness and yet still ample maltiness. Leather, lime, guava and other various tropical fruits linger long, with mild to moderate lactic character and soft, woody, oak tannins. Amazing stuff, and very, very different than the 2011 Golden Blend (non doesjel version). This one is far more approachable, but as well, I think its more flavorful and elegant, too.

375 mL bottle. Bottle dated 4/13/2012. Originally reviewed 5/12/2013.

Deep orange. The faintest well up of bubbles at the end. Very thin collar, but no head.

Aroma is trademark Drie Fonteinen sharp oak, white pepper, and some funk. Very malty smelling, too. Doesnt smell that acidic. Still kinda lemony with lots of white wine notes.

Dynamic flavor. Starts off with a bright lemony tartness. Then some sweetness, like a light caramel. Builds into a sharp oak flavor which peaks before leaving off with a grassy herbal character and a hay grain flavor.

Nearly flat. Just a slight hint of carbonation. Not all that sour by gueuze standards. 

Its very good, but Id take Oude Geuze over this, especially for the price and availability.

Aroma: barnyard, leather, sesame, fruity
Taste: light sour, tart, leather, barnyard, grain
Nice layered gueuze, with tart lemon at the fore, and a good dose of drying funk and very light green olive underneath. Over carbonation the only complaint.

(375ml 2012 bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Apr 29 2016) Pours nearly clear dark gold with a very small portion of white bubbles, some slight carbonation has developed. Nose is very similar to Golden Blend as expected, heavy on woody components, cellar, dry leaves, musty funk, preserved lemon peel, slight graininess and a touch of sweetness, acidity is present but in check. Palate again fairly similar to Golden Blend, lots of wood, hay and dry leaf bitterness to contain citrus and tart pale pit fruit notes, a bit of crabapple quality, some lactic and maybe a touch of acetic acid. Becomes quite mellow towards the finish with the initial bite of the wood rounding off with smooth tart lactic fruitiness with an underlying dry musty funk. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a very light spritz of carb. Very much like its fully refermented brethren but with a softer, smoother finish. Perhaps a bit laid back but very nice stuff as usual from 3F.

Bottle at Mikes 
Clear golden with a small white head, no lacing. Aroma is fruity and lemon. Flavor is fruity, straw, lemon with a dry, tart finish 
Easy drinking, smooth

Pickle juice and freshly burnt match aroma with some sour white grape. Clear orange under no head. Sour pickle juice flavour with a bright fruitiness: cranberry, white grape, peach. Burnt match is moderate to medium, but not necessarily bad. Light body, low carbonation, mouth puckering sourness.

Has an orange-amber color, no head. Low carbonation, reluctant aromas of floral hints, some leather, young grapes, with no tartness in the nose at all. Upwelling fruits in the beginning, with a very smooth mouthfeel, backed up by musty yeast. Then, sour tartness brings a new layer to the beer, without rolling over the established smoothness. Due to the lack of carbonation in this one, it becomes a little heavier on the palate, and therefore does not get distracted by metallic carbonation. This leaves the attention on the acidic sourness, mingled with grainy malt and oaken notes, which lingers on the palate in a gentle, fruity way for a long time. Also a slight sweetness is recognizable, in a soft, wine-like fashion, which gets washed away, as the lemon zest orientated aftertaste begins to dry out the palate. The sourness nontheless is pleasant on the tongue and well balanced throughout, as it leaven space for impressive sour and bitter notes.
Bottle. Color hazy orange with small white head. Aroma earthy, citric, sour, floral. Taste sour, fruits, citrus.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2016 2013 Vintage.Bottles consumed at home on various occasions.

AROMA: Quite subdued, fresh, tropical fruits. Mellow inviting and subtle Brett.

APPEARANCE: Golden, hazy, thin white head, little to no carbonation. Head quickly dissapates into nothingness. Looks very still and lifeless. Urine.

TASTE: Cloying yet very refreshing, quite sour, very well balanced, drinkable (very). Due to lack of carbonation oaky notes seem to come through more than the usual 3F blend. Mineral clean water comes through, soft water. Would pair amazingly with many foods.

PALATE: Long lasting citrus notes, very moreish. Delicious. Chalky, complex, piney, woodsy.

OVERALL : Gorgeous, yet another superb offering from 3F. For your hardcore Gueuze lovers. Loved it and will keep seeking it.

Bottle... Pours hazy and golden with no head. The aromatic highlights are fuzzy stone fruits, citric and citrusy lemon, and barnyard funk. Medium-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and soft carbonation. The flavor is tart and fruity with a bone-dry finale. Bottle generously shared by darkguardian!
Another great Drie Fonteinen beer. Lots of crisp grapefruit and crackery aroma. Pours hazy golden with good head and lacing. Bitter and tangy finish. Nicely done. Bottle shared at tasting.

375ml bottle pours clear golden with a small but lasting white head. The colour is brilliant! Funky aroma, not as intense as other 3F beers but nice. Flavor is more intense, big barnyard, deep sourness. Medium bodied, deep mouthfeel, average carbonation. Enjoyable.
From a bottle at the Nuplastikk returns DC gathering January 2016. Pours a clear copper with a scant off white head. Funky barnyard aroma. Flavors of band aids and dank basement.

375ml bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours semi clear orange with a tiny paper thin lauer of bubbles. A faint hint of carb. Nose is awesome with deep funky wet forest, barn hay, fuzzy musty orange and stonefruit. Taste is similar to the nose with a medium-low tartness, juicy barnyard stonefruit and wet basement, oaky goodness. Finishes with some orange, stonefruit, lemon, musty funk. Complex. Superb.
375 ml bottle. Pours s clear copper colour with no head. Aromas of farmyard, citrus and leather. Flavors carry same with additional muddled esters and sharp green apples. Very nice

(bottle, rating #5000) hazy golden-amber colour with no head. subtle yet complex aroma of lemon peel, coconut milk and dill, with some rather pronounced notes of juicy, good quality marzipan, a hint of acetone, cherry stones and oak. flavour is mostly bread dough, lemon juice and herbal hops, with lots of their dry barnacle house character, a touch of pears, shallots, some black pepper and a faint tartness in the light-bitter finish. full-bodied with soft carbonation.
Flaska från 2013. Orangegul, disig. Aningen stall i doften plus syrliga frukter. Fräsch smak med lite stall, gräsbeska och mycket syrlig frukt. Mycket välbalanserad. De Klomp 2015-12-19

Rating #1475 - 02.03.2015 - Bottle from CBI - Pours hazy golden with almost no head to speak of, like pear juice. Aroma of orange peel, lemon juice, and brett. Quite tart and juicy with a pronounced sourness - lingering acidity into the finish. Very nice.

Bottle shared late-nite at RBWG 2014 - Asheville. Cheers! Pours clear gold with a foamy, white head. Huge grassy nose, some citric lemon notes. Delicious. Light sweet flavour, well balanced, with moderate grassy bitterness, subtle funk, wood, earth, lemony tang. Light bodied with average carbonation. Lightly sweet on the finish, drying, super clean, with grass and tart citrus. Glorious.

375 ml bottle (?)

The third beer of the flight transitioned from southern Europe back to the home of the lambic. A reminder of why 3 Fonteinen remains one of the masters of the style, this world class experience tickles the palate and makes you wish that you could somehow get more after the final drop is poured.

Aroma / Appearance - A transparent body the color of rose gold sparkles and shimmers with no carbonation to speak of. Lemons dipped in a blue cheese sauce smell like some sort of funky champagne gone wrong. Musty chocolate bars left in an abandoned library complete the experience.

Flavor / Palate - Tart blue cheese, lemon wedges, and dusty fruit keep the palate alert sip after sip. A flat uncarbonated texture winds its way to a clean finish of flat Sprite, almonds, cheese, and horse blanket. Everything works together to prevent any one aspect getting out of hand. Whether you drink it now or save it for a special occasion the experience should be top notch.

(bottle - corked & caged 375 ml - 2012 vintage) Clear gold with very light carbonation. Tart and funky and salty aroma. Very dank and inviting. Flavor is salty and sour with a dry tart zest coming up at the end. [9/12/15]

Bottle at Cafe Rose Red, 29th October 15. Pours a rich straw yellow. Aroma is lemon, yeast, sour funk, cellar, great. Taste is smooth, funky sharp citrus, barnyard, damp cellar, slight wood. Very enjoyable
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear gold pour with a thin off-white head. Aroma of malt, funk, pepper and lemon. Malty and lemony flavor with a peppery sour finish.

Bottle in Cafe Rose Red. Darkish golden with no head, no carbonation (as expected). Aroma is funk, cider, malt vinegar, hint of honey. Medium-light bodied, smooth on the palate, tart with an oaky dry finish. Taste is crab apples, hint of lemon peel, dry white wine. Delicious.

Drunk from 37,5 cl bottle bought direct from the brewery in the open days. Fantastic tart lambic.

Bottle 2013 at La Fin Mousse. Poured clear gold with min-no head. Aroma dusty musky light tart lemon citrus. Min carb med bod. Tastes light sour funk barn lemon.
375ml of April 2012 release. Pours a pale brown color without any head. Low carbonation. Slight tar aroma. Some tar flavor and mild citrusy sourness.

Bottle @ hotel. Murky burnt orange pour with minimal white foam. Smells amazing. Tons of Bretty, musty, earthy funk along with bright citrus and white wine. Some orange and peach in there, too. A little flat and overly acidic on the tongue. Nice citric quality, though and plenty of damp funk. A solid lambic all around, but not the amazingness I usually expect from 3 Fonteinen.

Short white head. Perfect clear golden color.
Also a perfect crisp typical Gueuze aroma.
Compared to the normal 3 Fontaine Gueuze this has more brett caracter. Big stable taste and a soft acidity, more like apple acid. This is a bit bigger but not as fresh as the normal Gueuze.
KRS 240115. Golden-orange colour with some off-white bubbles. Aroma is fruit, sourness, funk. Flavour is orange, yeast, farmhouse, fruit, funk, sourness, lemon. Very nice beer.

Bottle, bought @De Hopduvel, Gent. Pours clear deep orange with a small, frothy, white film head. Aroma has lovely funk, green strawberries, oranges, light lactic, apricot peel. Mild barnyard, red apple. Low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is mild tart, firm maltiness, orange peel, orange juice, dry and dusty, mild funk. Lingering, light lactic tartness in the finish. Nice.

Looks..Amber..no head low carb
Smells.. Quite mild, green apple, lemon allowing the yeasty dank notes to shine.
Tastes..quite low carbo, smooth & rounded, though still very sour green apple, lemon, some oak and a woody dry finish. Amazing.
Cloudy orange with a tiny white head. Fruity and sour tones. Fruit, sour, dry and bitter. Medium body with a long balanced sour finish.
Smell is like a very mild sour. Almost no carbonation to speak of. Very light sour taste with a bit of wood and funk.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange amber, pretty low carbonation, whisp of an off white head ring with a touch of lacing. Aroma is quite funky, horse blankets, basements, sweatsocks, some stonefruit, yeast, dusty, oak. Flavor has a touch of iniital sweetness, drying out to a light tart, medium plus funky stonefruit experience. Quite approachable and drinkable actually, notes of lemon and oak along with nice horseblanket funk. Medium body, low carbonation. Enjoyable.

Bottle. Medium golden, low carbo, short-lived head. Funky, acidic aroma, footy and corky undertones. Cider vinegar, latex rubber, rindy cheese, quince, light musty cork, dry grappa-like bitter finish. Quite acidic, moderately funky, with nice yeast and interesting petroleum/rubber notes. Drinkable but with nice complexity. Another terrific gueuze from 3F.

text: Flaska från danska Khioskh. Gyllengul vätska med tunn skumslöja. Fruktig, murrig doft med grapearomer. Lätt syrlig smak. Ingen tungkrullare direkt, snarare åt det mjäkiga hållet.

Tiny white head, golden-amber body. Nose: Vinegar, stable, hay, yeast and hint of Parmegiano Reggiano. Aroma: Vinegar, yeast, hay, green apples, hint of Parmegiano Reggiano, dry Champagne and raspberry hard-candy. Semi-long/long ending with some bitterness.
Pours a dark murky Apple cider colour. Aromas are sourdough bread, vinegar. Flavours are very yeasty and bready. Also sour lemon and vinegar. But nothing overwhelming. Very balanced and delicious.

Pours a clear golden orange. At least the first half of the bottle. It stays pretty clear throughout. No head. The nose is mostly on oak and earthy aromas. The taste is on the lighter side for a 3F lambic. Some fresh lemon, again earthy tartness, a hint of leather and a slight bitter sensation in the end. The mouthfeel is thin to oily with very little carbonation. 
Refreshing and easy drinking is the verdict.

Pours a headless cloudy orange coloured body. Nose of lemon and floor cleaner. Flavour is good tartness but lacks the depth and puckeringness one would expect from Drie Fonteinen. Purchased a 375ml bottle at Metro Liquors University Heights for around $22.

375 mL bottle, had a few small samples from various bottles at Churchkey. Hazy straw color. Like 3F Oude Geuze but not quite the same depth. Expectedly slightly lower carbonation, very basement dank and musty, less vibrant than Geuze or Golden Blend. Still awesome funk, but not the same level.

375ml bottle shared @La Tana (Rome) with ippopotamo36. Unclear pale orange color with a small white head. Aroma of bretta, barnyard, hay, citric notes, nice but nothing exceptional for 3F standard. Flavour is medium to low sour with citric notes, tart, quite persistent. Medium body, low carbonation. A very good gueuze, but I expected something more.

Pours into a flute, mostly still, darker orangr yellow in.color. aroma is lightly funky and very fruity. Taste is slightly tart, fresh lemon flavor, a bit of funk then has a acidic finish. nice, but not worth the $20 i paid for it.
from Erzbierschof - quite clear amber beer with no foam; funky barnyard and cheesy aroma; fairly sour, good malt backbone, dry and long sourish aftertaste of barnyard, cheese and apples

Pour is golden amber with a small amount of tight white head. Nose is softer than some other 3F, light cob web, a touch of funk, tangerine and golden fruits. Everything seems a little soft and not as bright. Flavor is the same. A bit dusty, slightly malty, a touch sweet, tangerine behind, slightly sour. Lighter body, strong carb, dry finish. May need some time, just not as expressive as their other gueuze.

Pours hazy deep golden orange with a thin skim of white head diminishing rapidly to nothing, no lacing. (3/5) Nose is slightly muted, complex, horseblankety funk, tart citrus, woody and leathery, tobacco. (8/10) Taste is mild sweet, moderate tart, mild salt. (9/10) Medium bodied, zero carbonation, dry tart finish. (4/5)

A very good still gueuze. (Doesjel" means sleepy - as in, it hasnt been awoken by carbonation, geddit?) Because of the lack of carbonation, it comes across very similar to an unblended lambic, but this is in fact a blend of one, two, three, and four year-old lambics. (Really more like a tart uncarbonated white wine than most beers one could name.) The absence of carbonation means you can sip this for a long time, appreciating the changes in flavour as it warms and opens up. A lot of fun, and definitely worth trying for a sour aficionado, but not as good as the carbonated versions - I find the carbonation adds some texture and even some flavour, really livening it up and bringing it to the next level. (16/20)

Une bouteille 02/05/2013. Une drôle de bière plus près de la curiosité. Un robe orangé sans mousse. Un nez de sucre blond, légèrement gueuze. Une bouche qui ressemble à du ginger ale flat, elle na aucune texture. Manque dacidité. Je ne comprends pas trop lintérêt de cette bière, quest quune levure dormante ? Une cellule dormante !!

Thx Kev!  02/05/2013. Orange. Sans mousse et sans bulles. Nez funky. Touche fruitée, citron doux, pointe de fromage. Bouche plus fade. Lambic et faro. Aucune note vibrante citrique. Très léger et même un peu sucré. Corps sans vie qui donne une impression de minceur. Finale courte, bien loin des notes poignantes habituellement liées au genre.  Il y a quelque chose que je narrive pas à saisir ici.

Bottle poured by myself, in a location remote of a buse.
Pours a lightly hazy blonde, and indeed still.

The aroma is very funky, lemony, with some pear and oak. Terribly pungent & fine smelling. 

The flavor is modestly sour with some nice lemon rind some minerallity. Its got a midl brininess and a well refined but fairly muted oak character. 

So fun to see a sleepy Gueuze in such good shape.
Bottle. Clear golden pour. Smell is funk and leather. Taste follows with some fruit...maybe rhubarb. Nice clean finish. Awesome stuff!
Bottle shared by Tom - thanks! Golden pour with minimal head. Aroma is funk and leather. Some light fruit / wine character. Excellent.

Äpplig citrusdoft med träfatstoner. Ljus bärnstensfärg och ett mycket litet skum. En lätt jordig citronkaraktär dominerar smaken. Välavvägd syra som liksom växer fram. Fint torr avslutning och eftersmak.
Något för tunn kropp men annars en bra struktur. Totalt sett en helt okej men något menlös gueuze.

375 ml bottle. Bottled 02/05/2013. At the Tuulensuu, Tampere, Finland. 
Clear golden colour with no head. 
Tartness, vinegar, mustiness, dessert wine sweetness, sugar and dry apples in the aroma. The flavour is dry apples, sweetness, tartness, rhubarb, sugar and mild vinegar. 
One of the smoothest lambic ever. Where's the kick I paid for?

Ámbar limpio y uniforme, sin espuma. Aroma intenso y agrupado, manzana roja oxidada, saúco, madera y fondo mohoso suave. Cuerpo medio, inició dulce agrupado, manzana oxidada, acidez redonda y equilibrada y final moderadamente seco pero duradero.

Bottle. Hazy orange with tiny off-white head. Aroma is malt, tart, barnyard, lemon, little wheat and leather. Flavour is malt, tart, barnyard, lemon, little sour, little acid, oak, wheat, leather and a little bitter.

Pours a golden straw color with only a very thin egg shell colored head that faded almost immediately into a med-thin collar without wisps. Poor lacing but fair legs. Aroma is lightly tart, grassy, oaky, with a white grape mustiness to it. Taste is identical to the aroma but with the elements in a different order with each sip. Medium body, nicely sticky, fairly effervescent and bright on the tongue.

Clear reddish amberish color with absolutely no foam. The smell is decent like old feet and cheese and maybe apples. No carbonation at all, but it really doesnt matter in this one. Hidden, almost indirect sourness that makes this a very calm exquisite beer.
Orange color with hardly any head. Funk, hay, barnyard, apples, a bit spicy as well, leathery. Very complex. But still so refreshing and easy to drink. Flat. Wow.
Explosion of aromas. Sour cider sweet that gets bitter. Almost clear intense amber color. I don?t have a big expiwrience with these beers but I,m very impressed about complexity of the tastes.
UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 Bottle at home shared. Pours golden color, no at all head. Aroma is orange, tangerines, vinegaer. Taste is sour, medium bitter, orange peel, tangerines.

Bottle. Pours a luminous, slightly cloudy golden orange, no head. Aroma is muscat grape, orange, grain, lemon peel, semi-dry white wine, attic, dry and musty funk. Taste is cedar, brine, peach, apricot, and candied lemon, fading into fruit leather, apple skin, and a lingering oaky finish. On the fruity and nectary side but with underlying savory and saline qualities. Low carbonation. Really nice.
Bottle - Rubber, green grape and melon funk. Clear copper with almost nice head. Light fruity notes, petroleum, fruity with a long almost balsamic acidic finish.

Bottle uncorked..... take a giant inhale of beer smoke......... nose implodes with sour funk. Brew pours golden peach with no cap at all not even a single bubble floats on top. So funky smelling, cheese, dust, rubber, and more other stuff and thaaaaangs. Taste is the same but not as sour. Kind of flat feeling. Vinager is really shining through now. This is what it is.

Pours a clear golden body with light rim of white lacing. Aroma is light funk, fruit, lemon and barn. Mouthfeel is light and salty with a lightly sour note upfront, flavors of lemon and lime swirl with a nice funky mineral character.

Bottle to tulip
Citrus, balsamic vinegar, starch, horse blanket. Pours a nearly clear golden yellow with no head. Taste is lemon, green apple, grapes, funk, and gastric acid. This is light and very flat. I could have used more sour in the finish as it kind of just ended for me. Still, I enjoyed it.

Bottle, 375ml. An almost entirely clear one, golden in color and more or less flat. Some bubbles around the rim though. The aroma is funky and lemony, with barnyard and some malty hints. Cheesy notes too. Its rather flat in the mouth, medium bodied and quite tart. The flavor is lemony and funky, quite cheesy, and with barnyard and a malty hint. Lasting finish. I prefer some carbonation, but its sure a tasteful one. 150124

Bottle 375ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear deep golden with a few off-white bubbles. Aroma is sour with a notes of fruits, horseblanket, stable and funk. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium sour with a long dry, fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is flat.

Bottle. Pours deep golden with a tiny off-white head. Aroma of leather, funk some malt, stable and sour citrus. Flavor is sour and sweet with some leather, funk and malt. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a tiny white head. Tart sour berries in the nose. Taste is surprisingly mellow and low sour. It has good complexity, fruit, berries, wood, electical fire, leather, sweet white grapes, pepper. Drinks easy, I would not mind a bit more sourness in the finish to pick it up. It falls a bit flat which is a shame. Still a fine brew.

500ml bottle pours a slightly cloudy pale amber color with a small white head that leaves no lacing on the glass. Aroma is sour lemon with some yeast and grains. Taste is a lemon sourness and a dry yeast finish. Medium body with not a lot else going on.
1 year old 375 ml bottle. Pours a golden yellow with no head. Aroma is funk and green apples. Taste is tart green apples, mild sour acidic. Minimal carbonation. Very smooth to drink.

375ml bottle courtesy of skullgeorge. Hazy golden orange color with small white head. Fruity citrusy aroma, funky, barnyrad notes, some wood. Taste is sweet and light sour like the aroma. Medium thin to oily body with soft carbonation.

37,5cl bottle from source, bottled 05/2013-bb2023. Pours flatter than a cask pour faro at the source. At once commands attention despite its lack of carbonation by binding radiant sulphuric green apple peel tartness to orchard funk, old lemon peel and a touch of white pepper. Taste is remarkably lemony sweet with a great array of overaged hop cheese, - excellent mouthfeel and drinkability: sessionable terroir lemonade with an edge over straight-up amfora lambic.

First beer in 2015, lets start this one with a bang (or lack of, really since it shouldnt be carbed)! Pours a slick and shiny golden with no head except from what was created by my semi-vigourous pour that promptly go away. You are then left with still liquid gold. Nose is of green apples, dust, cheese rind, sweat and general funkiness. Feeling really fresh overall. Taste is lightly tart, really classy. It offers some light apricots (or at least sour-ish fruits) and pepper. Green apples and herbs. Oak is there but never overpowering. Light bitterness. Body is medium and texture super oily. A really soft feeling, I could drink a lot of that. Awesome drink, really!
Bottle from mikkeller and friends, copenhagen. Deep golden color, small white head. Aroma is sour apples, fruits, some stables. Taste is balanced sour apples, fruity, stables.

Bottle bought @ Etre Gourmet IIRC. Pours hazy deep brownish orange with a small bubbly offwhite head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is musty and funky with sourdough crackers, moist old dark bread, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, hay, dry soil, moist wood, green apples, barnyard, damp basement, leather and lemon zest. Taste is sour, slightly fruity, musty and funky with sourdough crackers, sourdough bread, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, green apples, yoghurt, leather, barnyard, minerals, moss, moist wood and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, flat and medium bodied. Finish is sour with sourdough bread, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, green apples, gooseberries, moist wood, leather, barnyard and lemon zest. Smells of that beautiful musty 3 Fonteinen funk and the taste follows suit but without the carbonation it gets a bit dull after a while...

Corked bottle. Golden color, no head. Oak, citrus and cherry lemonade in the aroma. Honey and apricot. Almost flat, Complex flavor. Oak, some remaining hops, honey, lemon. White pepper, vanilla, cherry sweets. Powdery mouthfeel. Amazing beer.
Flat, golden. :) Lots of smileys. Birds flying all over. Flowers showers. Smileys. Smiley.

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a tiny off white head. Aroma is mild citrus, tart, oak. Flavor has a nice lemon citrus, oak dryness, slightly tart. Little to no carbonation, tastes pretty flat. Decent sour lingering in the finish. Would be a much better beer if it wasnt so undercarbonated.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Definitely the funky brett you expect from the nose. 

The taste is definitely sour and fun to drink given the geuze blend. 

The only issue I have is the complete lack of any CO2 to support the beer. I must have had a dead bottle as I did not have any head.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 Bottle from JefVerstraete, many thanks. Hazy orange golden color with medium white head. Tart aroma with vinous notes, barnyard, horse blanket, funk. Tart taste with apples, lemon, barnyard, funk, wood.
Bottle at home by Cuso, thanks. Pours golden color, no head. Aroma is acidic, orange, tangerines. Taste is sour, medium bitter, acidic, very fruity, orange peel, tangerines.

Backlog rating. 37.5cl bottle from Etre Gourmet. It pours a clean golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is acidic, funk and woody, with notes of citrus peel, cognac barrel, tart berries, earth, tangerine, spritzy tart candies. Taste is medium acidic and medium sweet with notes of citrus peel, wet soil, wood, funk, orange peel, barnyard and hay. Finishes acidic and dry, with light alcohol presence. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Standout lambic

Small bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a medium white head. A big fruity dusty, brett nose. The flavor is big sweet green grapes, dry mellow at times. Very mellow. Smooth and base of sweet fruit.

Bottle shared by Douglas. Thanks!A: Clear gold with a thin white head. Lacing. N: Oak, lemon, grapefruit, funk, bark dust, coriander, horse blanket, acetic acid, cheese. Some pear and green apple; green grape.T: Pleasing tartness, very light biscuit.M: Sleepy carbonation, light body, no alcohol presence. O: Very calm lambic. A lazy version of the oude gueze. Good show.

Clear golden pour with no head. Such a lazy beer. Smells really nice, lots of musty oak in this one - the brett character is very complex and pronounced in this beer. Notes of green apples, yuzu, oranges and a small nuttiness. This is a really easy drinking beer. The perfect lawnmower beer. Acidity is not too harsh, but very gentle in fact, it is perfectly quenching, and the only thing bad about this beer is that I cant afford to drink 2 litres of this a day, cause I havent gotten my deal through with the diamond dealer in Sierra Leone because of all the fuzz with Ebola. So I urge everyone to donate, donate donate to the fight against Ebola, so I can get my business going.
Bottle at Biercab. Golden-orange colour with white lace. Fruity, citric aroma. Sweet, fruity, wood, sour taste. Medium body.

bottle shared by minderbinder, many thanks bro for the waiting! pours clear bright orange with a small white rind, few lacing spots. citrus zest, grapefruit, drie funkiness, toasted wheat, oranges and spices, winey and grapey, light acidity - lactic, citric and just a touch acetic; grass, astringent oak, pepper. flat carbonation, light body - oily, very dry grassy-herbal-peppery finish. very good - yet i prefer 3fog or a carbonated version of golden doesjel, i.e. golden blend.

Bottle 375ml. Thx Tommy!
Pours golden with no serious head to speak off (would be white). Aroma is of grapefruits, citrus, wild yeast, some funk, oak. Taste is of sourness, faint bitterness, wood, alcohol as it warms up. Palate: Light-medium body. No serious carbonation. Overall: Slightly mouth puckering at first. Quite juicy. Fine. Well balanced. Lots of grapefruits. I find that the lack of carbonation makes this one hard to size, and to some extent hard to appreciate at its full potential. Still outstanding indeed.

Appearance: Clear deep golden color with a smal white head.Aroma: Fermented apples.Palate: Medium (+) body. Balanced sweet, pleacant acidic and a moderate bitterness. Soft carbonation. Dry ending.Taste: Citric, wood and apples.Overall impression: Pleasant easy drinkable lambic. Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget web order, Sweden

375 ml bottle at Pipes of Scotland, thanks Per! Clear golden with no head. Aroma faint, funky, barny brett notes and not much else. Taste is wonderful, fresh, fruity, brett, barn with a long, tart and fruity finish. Very nice

Sample at the 2014 Infected Chimipalooza on 11/01/2014. Hazy orange color with a thin white head that evaporates quickly to a wispy film. Stringy lacing. Aroma of citrus, yeast and malt. Medium body with flavors of lemon, wine grapes, oak and yeast. The finish is tart with a funky grapefruit aftertaste. Solid beer all around.

Bouteille de la Capsule Nancy.
Couleur jaune orangée trouble, mousse qui disparaît. Fort nez aigrelet, raisin, peau de pomme, note boisée écorce humide, note allumette brulée, complexe mais fort et long. Gout bien aigre, raisin vert pas mur, fruits verts, avec note tannique, boisée vieux, acidulée, Voir acidulée citron, herbes fraiches, et menthe en retro nasal. Le tout bien long en bouche. 
Complexe et super gouteuse, un délice!
Le style que jaime

Bottle 37,5cl kindly shared by Calisky. A cloudy copper beer without head. Nose is fruity with brett touch but sweet like. Aroma is on apple skin and wet wood, medium tart, dry but not as much as Cantillon ones, cooked vegetable notes, medium sour, green fruits, astringency, white wine notes. Again a good stuff from this brewery.
a very drinkable gueuze, clear dark orange, small white head. mild sour aroma, smooth and subdued, flavor is sour, dry, very drinkable, mild. Sourness is very round, and not very citrussy.

Bottle @ Home. Pours slightly hazy golden with a very small offwhite head, some light lacings. Aroma of sourness, barnyard, wood, lemonzest, dusty, white grapes, citrus. Flavor is lightly sour,citrus, lemon- and orangezest, wood, light white sugar, barnyard. Medium body, flat carbonation, nice dry light acidic finish. 081114
11/2/2014. 375 ml. caged and corked bottle. Amber color with no head. aromas are funky and fruity. Tart right off with herbal and grassy notes. Sour Brett finish with hints of oak.

Pours a cloudy golden orange with little head or lacing. Musty, funky aroma with some earthiness, lemon and peach. Taste is moderately tart with some cheesy and barnyard character. Some lemon, peach and mild grassy hops and a dry, oaky finish. Mouthfeel is a little flat for the style with a light/medium body and light carbonation. A good tasting gueuze but under carbonated. I expected more from this brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Small format bottle. Pours a gold with a thin white head. Aroma is wood, honey, watermelon rind. Taste is smooth, mellow tartness. Low carbonation.

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of brettanomyces, lemons, and straw. The flavor is acidic with a sweet undertone and notes of brettanomyces, wood, lemons, and straw, leading to a tart finish.

Bottle at Taphouse.
Hazy amber colored with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of barnyard and oak with notes of sweat.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of white wine and barnyard with notes of oak.
Tart finish.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Earthy, horseblanket, leathery. Citric, fruity, light sour and citrusy. Smooth fruity, citric and crisp fruity finish.

Bottle (dated 13/04/2012) from The Bottle Shop, Bermondsey store. Slightly hazy rustic orange, bubbles clinging to the edge of the glass. When I opened the bottle there was barely a pop and carbonation is very minimal. No head. Nose is tangy, white apple flesh when it goes brown, lots of horse blanket and funk, goats cheese rind, old leather, quite fruity with grapefruit and lemon rind, acidic, sour. Can smell the younger blend with extra tangyness and mustiness. Taste is tart, sour and tangy. Lemon acidic sour, funky farmyard and horse blanket. As it lingers on the tongue theres fresh grapefruit acidic. Dry and cider like. It doesnt have that clean crisp sour bite of the top gueuze beers, its softer, more tangy, with the earthy musty farmyard notes coming through, but with a nice citrous sour tartness.

Bottle: 2 years old (2012). Murky amber, burnt golden body with not much of a head, rather just a soapy, slightly bubbly white collar grouped at the perimeter. Welcome to funkytown. Huge funky & sweaty aroma with tons of acidic, sharp lemon, grape skin, & green apple notes alongside a strong woody & oak laden body. A bit leathery with lots of musky, damp hay, barnyard stall, & some sweaty feet. Nice stone fruit & mineral bite on the back-end. Flavor is smooth with an oily body, not much carbonation, though still more than expected, actually. Tons of citrusy, bright sourness, lemon flesh, brettanomyces funk, wey hay, tons of sweat & horsey notes... Loving the funk here. Vividly dry finish with notes of old, worn out leather, musky tannins, sweat socks, hard water, & acidic stone fruits. Great.

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. green bottle, April 13, 2012, corked and capped poured into a tulip. Hazy light orange with very small white head, medium body, low carbonation, and little big-bubble lacing. Taste is tart, earthy, and some barrel. Not the same caliber as their oude geueze.

More Lambic popping at home. Pours flat golden orange with nice funky nose of barnyard and citrus. tastes of limes, wet wood, barnyard, grapefruit, some green grapes. Wonderful Palate that goes down easy with enough liveliness to make subdued flavors sing. Quite a good one.
Bottle @ ZZT9 shared by Martinus. Clear golden colour with no head. Smells and tastes sour, fruity, lemon, sweet, muf.

Clear golden colour, slight white head. Aroma of citrus, white wine, straw, lemon peel, sourdough bread, brett. Tart flavour, malts, citric acid, light sour, light white pepper, lemon peel. Only a bit of CO2 present. Finish fresh sour fruits, quite tart, citrus, lemon peel, marmelade, lemon jam. Great!
(From 37.5cL bottle shared @ RBBWG 2014, Gent)
2014.09 - fles 37,5cl - koperkleurig, licht troebel, geen schuim - neus : zurig, fruitig, zacht - mond : prikkelend, fruitig, appeltjes, aangenaam zurig
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours golden with no head and a fruity aroma. There is a subtly sour fruit flavor with a dry finish that sticks to the palate. Reminds me of fresh grapefruit.
375 c&c from The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours gold with no head. Funky aroma. Med minus body. Clean funky flavor. Smooth and tart. Mildly sour. Effect is very grapefruit. Excellent!

Bottle shared with pat, Dallas and Vinny. Pours a clear golden body with light rim of white lacing. Aroma is light funk, fruit, lemon and barn. Mouthfeel is light and salty with a lightly sour note upfront, flavors of lemon and lime swirl with a nice funky mineral character. Nice blend.

37,5 cl from the brewery. Pours a clear amber gold with lactic acid and sweet apple on the nose. Very light character and not that sour. Soft and sweet character. Will age this one as it will mature and taste fuller in a few years. Prefer the young Vintage ofcourse, or golden blend.
Een typische geuze zoals het hoort te zijn. Echt een lekkere geuze. Een aanrader om eens te proberen

Corked and caged bottle. Cork opens without a sound. Pours nearly flat orange with no lacings or head to speak of. Green apple skin, light funk, citrus and wheat. Solid but doesnt come close to the Golden Blend.

Bottle at home from Belgiuminaboxpours clear burnished amber gold with lactic acidity and dry rotting hay on nose. Light body and carbonation, fairly citric with a residual sweetness but dry earthy finish.
375ml bottle. Pours dark orange with no head. Aroma is woody lemon, ashy cheese and a little funk. Taste is sour cheese to start with a light funky finish. Flat, watery mouthfeel.

Bottle. Dark hazy gold. Huge funky yeast aroma. The taste adds apple, champagne qualities, pear, lemon, and very light wood on the finish. Sweet tart puckery mouthfeel at first that quickly calms to an apple juice sweet refreshingly lightness. Very complex. Excellent. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy gold with almost no head. Aroma and taste are musty funk and super bright citrus. Very tart. Slightly under-carbed and thin. Incredibly drinkable and really tasty. Love it.

375ml bottle. BBE 2023. Deep golden, no head. Small bubbles in the glass. Nice funky, barnyardy aroma, apples, some sweetness. Flavor has green apples, funk, sweet notes, some green gooseberries in the finish. Really tart finish, with sweetness more in the beginning. Really mouthdrying. Not topnotch, but something I would gladly drink again anytime.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle shared by BeerandBlues2, thank you sir! Hazy golden color, small off white edge head. Aroma of dusty light lemon. Taste is funky tart citrus. Nice.
(bottle 20/08-2014) very low white head, slightly unclear yellow color, smooth sour aroma and taste, dry taste, slightly horse stable taste.

Slightly hazy golden with a tiny white head. Quite weak aroma of funk, wood, fruit and malt. Sweet and tart complex funky flavour, with fruity and wooden notes. You can easily tell that this is great, but its not quite the same masterpiece as the golden blend geuze

2012 bottle (375ml). Flat orange, zero head, lightest carb. Peach, citrus, light grapefruit and decent funk on the nose; good peppery spice note in there, fairly musty. Taste gives good lemon rind and fairly acidic citrus juice, peaches in there sweetening it up. Waxy lemon comes in along with the funk; medium sourness - not a tongue stripper, citric acidity and funk laid on in a subtle way. Musty spice and peach linger alongside the lemony funk. Refreshing, mellow and well put together. Good well-balanced stuff.
Luktar lagom surt. Bubblar lite när man häller upp, sedan inte mycket..Bra balans. Gillar.

2012 bottle opened in 2014. Golden (what else) pour with little white head. Aroma is funk, some lemon and apricot, also some faint peach. Taste is similar with some oak, grape must. Smooth, acidic and light on the palate. Really solid stuff.

Bottle shared by beerandblues2. Pours clear golden amber with fizzy off-white head. Aroma is cereal and biscuit malts, funk, light sour fruits, lacto, and faint grassiness. Flavor is dry malts, light sour esters, some vinegar, some toast, and faint hops; dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.
From a bottle. Pours hazy orange copper with a fizzy white head. Smells like sour orange and yeast. Tastes like fermenting oranges, bananas, light fruity sweetness.

Bue en bouteille de 37.5cl couleur dorée, col mousseux inexistant, petite tache blanche sur la surface, quelques bulles mais aucune efervescence en bouche. Grosse attaque sur le citron et le petit lait assez prégnant ce dernier peut être trop même car il reste tout le long de la dégustation en bouche.

Sampled April 2014
A steady pour into my large Tripel Karmeliet tulip produces a faint ring of a head that is a pale, off-white colored head. The aroma is musty, woody, and quite funky with an off fermented fruit like character, and a musky dank foot like character; really this smells like the rind of a funky, earthy, wildly fermented cheese. This is one of the more funky Lambics that I have had, not to mention the fact that this is from 3 Fonteinen. Up front there is a sharpness that is a mix of lactic acid, cat urine, sharp hay like notes, and an oak like spiciness.

My first sip is lightly carbonated, with a nice lactic tartness to it, but is not nearly as sour as I might have expected. The finish has a lingering grapefruit like character to it, as well as a sharp, grassy, cat urine leaning, nicely biting, slightly astringent, perhaps woody character. Musty, sort of mushroom leaning, earthy woody notes, as well as dank in an earthy, damp, cellar like manner. The body is nice and light, and makes this entirely too quaffable, but it still has some viscosity to it such that it is not overly thin; the lactic acid definitely helps with this, as does the oak astringency. The oak character provides a light spiciness here that takes on a bit of clean, white pepper like character.

As with most Lambics, a 375ml bottle of this is not nearly sufficient; this is quite tasty, and I really like how funky this is, quite a bit more so than the usual 3 Fonteinen, though the aroma is more funky than the flavor.

Pours a cloudy golden orange with little head or lacing. Musty, funky aroma with some earthiness, lemon and peach. Taste is moderately tart with some cheesy and barnyard character. Some lemon, peach and mild grassy hops and a dry, oaky finish. Mouthfeel is a little flat for the style with a light/medium body and light carbonation. A good tasting gueuze but under carbonated. I expected more from this brewery.

Bottle from Systembolaget. (I had this one after midnight to celebrate the start of my August vacation in 2014)

A bit hazy golden with no head. Aroma of apples, wood, grapes and funk. Similar taste. Low carbonation and very drinkable. Not that sour. An excellent beer!
Very clear taste of Brettanomyces, but I am calling for carbonation. This had lifted to unimagined heights if there was only a little foam and bubbles.

375ml bottle. Great vinous smell, though hard to pick out something specific. A lot if citrus, mostly line and lemon, and of course the brett. Otherwise very hard to pick out, as it is very complex. Definitely one of the best lambics I have had.

Bottle at home. Pours clear dark gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with spare lacing. Aroma is bright lemon zest and lactic fruits, grapes and earthy, barnyard yeast with stale earthy hops. Flavor is moderate lactic acid, grapes and lemon with crisp pale malt, light hops and bitterness with a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark orange body with a miniscule white head and little signs of carbonation. Aroma is massive tones of bretty horseblanket, stable and sweaty barnyard funk, red berries, lemon, straw and hints of citric peel and lactic tartness. Taste is barnyard funk, horseblanket, tart citric tones, lactic sour notes, hay and hints of sweet cereals and unripe red berries in the back. Light to medium body, soft to non-present carbonation. A truly sour beer in the literal sense of the word, with loads of bretty goodness thrown in the mix. The lack of carbonation hampers the experience a bit, but this is still a very good beer.

375ml bottle. Pours out a light amber shade with a shallow covering of bubbles. Aroma is cider apple, straw. Taste is fairly juicy and still quite young tasting. Definitely stiller and less carbonated than I would expect. Oak barrel coming through in the finish. This one really seemed to offer something different with each pour.

Flaska från SB. Äppekjuicefärgad, ingen kolsyra. Citrus, gröna omgona syrliga äpplen, trä och funk i doft och smak. Väldigt drickbar med balanserad syra, lätt sötma och stramt syrlig i munnen, lätt men påtaglig beska med grapedrag. Riktigt gott.

Bottle - Pours amber w/ no head. The aroma is tart, sour, lemon zest, and woody/grassy. The taste is a little sweet w/ a sour finish. Grassy and herbal notes. Plus lemon zest and other citrus notes. Everything is nicely balanced and overall very drinkable.
375 ml bottle. Medium dark gold, with minimum carbonation. Nice sourness, funky, lemon peel, horseblanket, hay, leather, and wood. Nice.
Flaske, 375 ml. 2013 vintage. Næsten klar ravgylden. Farmhouse funk, træ, citron. Vinøs. Sur-sød balance. Men desværre helt flad i karboneringen.

37.5 cL bottle at home. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small to medium white head. Aroma has quite some wood, some citrus, barnyard, quite typical 3F aroma. Taste is medium sour with barnyard, some wood and citrus. Quite some body, not really dry. Soft carbo. Nice stuff.
(375ml bottle) near still medium golden. Nose of hibiscus, farmhouse funk, light lemon, sour golden raisin. Taste is medium tart, lightly funky, flowers, love the tart, and mostly still finish.

Bottle split with Andy at BBH. Poured light hazy golden, no head with light carbonation. Aromas and flavor are very lemonade funk forward with some other minerals, wet wood, horseblanket and lemon skins. Easy going and more refreshing than normal doesjel. Still has a minimal bitter and drying finish. Good stuff.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear orange/amber pour with a tiny white head that quickly disappears, lemon rind aroma, taste has lemon, citrus, a hint of grapefruit, wood, barnyard funk, straw, perfect level of sourness, excellent as expected.

Bottle from systembolaget. Very distinct smell of sour beer and some dry fruits. Pours light amber with no head. The taste is short with a touch of sour and salt. Palate is thin and it is a very nice beer for summer. The taste dosent stay long, but just enough for the taste to be pleasant

Bottled:Pours deep amber with a very small head. Not much carbonation to speak of.Earthy aroma with notes of rhubarbs and sour apples.Really sour taste of rhubarbs, red currants and apples. Hints of raisins in the background.

375 ml bottle @ PBF IX. Pours a golden colour without a head. Aroma of red berries, lemon notes and some floral notes. Flavour of sour apricot, floral hops, some oregano herbal notes, wood and vinegar. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Dry sourish mouthfeel with a sour, sharp, berryish finish. Quite easy

375 ml bottle @ PBF IX. Bottled on 05/2013. BBE 2023.
Pours golden color with a minimal head. Nice sourish apricot and peach on the nose, some gooseberry bush and grass also. Mouth-drying effect, some yeast, lemony fruits and some green apples. Very nice, could be a bit more sour though.

Bottle. Aroma has got notes of apples, earth and some wood. Taste is a bit sweeter than expected. Its very fruity with a tasty apple mix. Low carbonation. Very smooth. Somewhat reminds me of a artisinal cider.

Jodå, här blir man inte besviken, smaken är ljuvligt frisk med klart syrliga toner. Balansen är väl avvägd här och kroppen precis så fin som man önskar.

Bottle from Ølbutikken. Thanks to Chrisv10 for picking this up. Drank this to celebrate my birthday. Clear orange with a tiny white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, grapes, barnyard, wood and leather. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Light dry and moderate acidic finish. Flat and soft. 180614

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks DSG. Cloudy amber and headless. Ripe peach, acidic, then more delicate fruit puree aroma. Very acidic, very sour taste. Medium body, no carbonation, long, delicate sour finish.

Bottle. Hazy deep golden liquid with small white head. Aroma of lemon, apple skin, apples, barnyard, mineral and grain. Taste is dry and light to medium sour with notes of lemon, apples and barnyard. Medium bodied with very low carbonation. Great.

375mL bottle at t Antwaerps Bierhuyske, pours a hazy golden with a few bubbles for head. Nose is extremely funky, like a cross between a gueuze and the type of funk from an unblended lambic - horse blanket and must. Flavour is complex, with horse blanket and funk, with a very soft palate. Loads of depth, with a funky, soft palate - which is unusual. Very high complexity and high drinkability. Wonderful.
375 ml bottle. Hazy amber with no head. A small smell of hay and sourness. Taste is sour with hay and stable. Low bitterness and low carbonation.

Bottle, 06/10/2014. Pours golden amber, white head fades relatively quickly, leaving a thin ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is earthy barnyard funk, grapes, mildly tart apple, wet wood. Taste is funky, buttery lambic, mildly tart grapefruit, apricot, white grapes, bitter citrus, some hay, dry finish. Soft round mouthfeel, little carbonation. Lovely.

Bottle 375ml. corked @ home. [ As 3 Fonteinen Golden Doesjel ].Clear medium orange color with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy manuer, horse blanket - barnyard, grapes, tart, apples, tart apples, wood, funky. Flavour is moderate sweet and acidic with a long duration, sharp, tart, manuer, grapes - citric, funky. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is flat. [20140411]

4/13/2012 bottle date. Mild whimper from the cork as it opens; pours a still, translucent gold color with zero head. Reasonable for the (doesjel lambic) style. 

Pungent, cheese-inspired funk grabs my olfactory senses. Dry, barnyard grassyness fools me into thinking there's more than 2 years of age on this bottle. Wow. That 4th year lambic contributes serious depth. 

More of the same on the palate. The lambic's inherent citric sourness balances perfectly against the funky, bitter yeast. Strongly prefer this to both Golden Blend and (comparably aged) 3F geuze. I need many, many more bottles of this stuff.

Bottle 37,5 cl, vintage 2012. Hazy darker golden in color with a small head. Sour notes, barnyard, some 

earthy notes, minerals and lemon in aroma. Lemon, sour notes, more barnyard and leathery notes 

in taste. Tart mouthfeel. Funkyness and grapefruits in aftertaste.

Bottle shared at a tasting at kerenmks place. Pours yellow to orange hazy, aroma of yeast, peach, fruit sweetness, tangerine with lots of brett and barnyard, flavor of peach, brett, tangerine, barnyard, lemon, nice bitterness, medium bodied, great.
Fairly clear light orange with minimal head. Big huge funky barnyard and Gueuze aroma. Much more huge funky flavor, horse blanket, funky, some citrusy fruit juice flavor. Yum.

Bottle thanks to DrewFace. Pours orange yellow, no head. Aroma is sour, tart, light. Taste is same, light and tart. Not much funk, or carbonation. Kind if hurts the mouthfeel, its basically flat. Not bad, not great.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Golden with almost no head. 
Sour aroma, like rubber, along with sweetish notes. 
Really sour flavour; lemon, lemon-peel, lime, rubber.

Bottle. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Tart with typical 3F lemon zest highlights. The bouquets follows suit. Good body and mouthfeel. Feels a bit young. Needs to develop in the bottle for a couple years.

375ml dark green, cork and wire bottle bought at Systembolaget Storheden and shared with djoeye. Pours an unclear amber coloured body under a tiny, white bubbly head. Dust, bread and drying aromas. Flavoured with farmyard together with tart and dry fruits, yeast and bread. More drying tartness to the finish. Partially refreshing, not a favourite (hotel room, Luleå 24.05.2014).

Green 375ml bottle 6% apx 10 (!)
