Unclear amber beer. 0 head.
Aroma close to white wine, fermented peaches, champagne, dough, wheat-bread.
Fresh-sour and fruity taste; peaches, fruit juice, dust, oranges, green apples.
Sparkling feel on palate, very juicy, very "gueuzy".
Finishes in yeasty fruitiness, "gueuziness".
Very interesting experience, much closer to white wine than beer, not bad to my taste buds though.
(shared w Rune @Park Hotel (Luleå) Sat24May2014)

Bottle. Pour is cloudy gold with almost no head. Pretty classic gueuze appearance. Aroma is funky, lemony, tart, and lightly woody. Smells like gueuze. Flavor is funky and tart up front but not as much of either as expected. Also lightly woody with notes of hay. Solid beer with funky and tart components in balance. Not excessively complex and still quite refreshing.

Oklar, guld färgad med ett nästan obefintligt skum. Doft: Vinäger, äppel kart, omogna krusbär, våta men rena kläder, regn, våt halm.Smak: Äppel kart, omogna krusbär, gräs, funk, citron syra, sur grape.

Bottle. Pours deep golden with a minimal white head. quickly dissipating. Aroms is tart apple, citrus, barnyard, oak, very apple cider like. Taste is sweet and tart apples, lingering tart finish. Light/medium body, very low carbonation, almost flat.

A- Pours a deep golden color with little to no head.

S- Lemon rind, apple cider

T- Tart, lemon rind, acidic, light maltiness, wheat, light fruit.

M- Low carbonation medium bodied.

D- Very well put together, extremely balanced, sour and acidic but kept me wanting more through every sip. I would definitely drink this again should I have the chance.

Looks like apple juice. Flat. Nose is apple juice, a touch of lemon, very light funk, some straw. Taste is apple juice and then some tart and bitter lemon, very little funk. Soft palate. If I got anymore bottles Id hold onto them for a while and hope this develops.

Its a decent beer but hugely dissapointing from the price tag. Oddly sweet and chemical like upfront with a finish of tart cheese and caramel. Really funky and sweaty tasting with more chemical sweetness on the finish. Oaky and complex but muddled and strange.

375 ml bottle (dated April 13, 2012) poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Pours a hazy opaque apricot yellow with a bit of off-white ring. Aromas of barnyard funk, oak, some sort of funky smoke. Tastes of citrus, lemons, light vinegar, oak, funk, light tartness. Light body with a very dry finish. Low carbonation, light juicy mouthfeel. Pretty nice.

Bottle shared at a tasting at kerenmks place. Cloudy deep golden-orange. Lovely barnyard aroma with oak, lots of fruits, quite a bit of citrus and a light leathery hint. Really pleasant sour flavor, very fruity, with barnyard, oak and a slightly lemony finish. Light to medium-bodied, flat and smooth. Wonderful stuff.
Hazy gold pour, no head. Flat as can be, but tasty as hell. Flavors of leather, barnyard, old clothers, lemon, wet hay, some light biscuit malts. Damn tasty!

Pour out of 375 mL bottle, huge thanks to Aaron for the generous pour! Slightly hazy golden-amber pour with nice white head, aroma brought notes of big gym socks, funky earthy notes, hints of lemon, oak, slight lacto in there, touch of sour grain, biscuit. Taste is a mix of oak, earth, vanilla, nice lacto into big funky notes, barnyard, dirty socks, smelly locker room, finishing fairly tart, very funky. I love these kinds of brews.

Bottle. C&C with not much action when opening. pours a nearly still, fairly clear orange-ish yellow with no head. A few white bubbles come out with some swirling. Aroma is slightly tart with some hay and earthiness. Taste is much more puckering than aroma would lead you to believe. A ton of citrus and lemon, almost bitter and pithy. A touch, but not much carbonation. Refreshing. Shows a balance of tart but still has some residual sweetness to it. Pretty nice.

Pours hazy amber no head
Aromas nicely balanced between sour grapes, green apples, citrusy fruits and hints of caramel sweetness
Taste nicely sour from green apples, citrusy fruits. 
Wee bit light ending
light soft sour aroma,golden, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, nice sour fresh finish.

Bottle. Hazy deep golden color with a thin white head. Acidic aroma of apricot and lambic yeast. Dry taste with medium bitterness. Flavors are wheat, apricot and apple.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head, diminishing. Sharp aroma, wood, barnyard, acid. Flavor is acidic too, finish light bitter. Dry texture.

375 ml bottle, very strong vinegar acidity, some shoe and foot funk with a light light soft carbonation. Tasted blind against 2007 drie fontenien oude gueze and golden blend and lost. Was ok, not at all worth the money.
Bottle @ Assentoft tasting. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are farmyard, leather, brett, hay, sour malt and has a nice balanced sour finish.

Bottle. Frothy White fair mostly deminishing head. Dark yellow colour. Powerfull sour barnyrad horseblanket aroma. Powerfull sour wonderfull flavor. Slightly sweet. Long powerfull complex finish. Creamy palate.
37,5cl bottle at home. Poured a clear orange colour with no head. Some white bubbles. Nice sour grapes, green apples, wood, lemons, apricots, vinegar, sour aftertaste. Low carbonated. Nice beer

375ml green corked and caked bottle, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy orange with no head. Aroma of barnyard, ripe apples, table grapes and a hint of vinegar. Flavours of green apples, table grapes, lemon and wooden notes. Taste is light sweet, light bitter and medium sour. Palate is medium bodied, slick texture and soft carbonation. A nice style typical Gueuze.

Wee bottle from SB cons 2014-05-13 - my wifes birthday dinner, Göteborg
AR: tart, white grapes, sour dough
AP: golden clear, wee transparent quickly disapearing head
F: tart white capes, fizzy, sour dough, white wine - not that sour

Bottle. Pours with a moderate amount of white fizz that fades over a hazed golden body. Aromas are of complex and delicious funk with lots of lemony acidity, floral, must, a touch briny. Moderately leathery. Flavors are tart, earthy, waxy funk, damp autumn leaves, moderate mineral qualities, acidic. Missing the high carbonation that a regular gueuze would have. Very nice, but I prefer the carbonic bite. Quite bitter and woody. Lower (~2.1ish vol) CO2. Dry and tart.

Pours hazy golden amber with no head. Aroma of  wild funky notes, sulfur, bacteria, vinegar, stable and sour berries. Taste of wild funky Brett notes, vinegar, sour berries, a bit of sulfur, bacteria, and some goose berries. Very nice!

Bottle shared with friends @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Pours golden hazy with a tiny and shortlasting head. Almost no carbonation. Aromas of very subtle almost minty sourness. Horsey and woody. Stablehouse and grass. Tastes of sourness, grass with lots of wood and an earthy taste.

Pours Golden amber. Hazy with almost no head. Aroma is very sour. Explicit vinegar. Dry, wooden brett. Taste is very tickeling despite the low carb. Sour with lots of grape fruit and sour citrus. As mentioned low carb. Great sour!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
@Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget. Arom: Brett, druva. Smak: Syrlig, fruktig, brett. Avslutningen är torr.
@ Ölprovning på Havregatan. Flaska från Systembolaget. Fruktig och rejält syrlig, en aning brett, citrus. Lång och torr avslutning.
Bottle at Mikkeller&Friends. Cloudy golden - small white bubbles. Horsey. Funky. Lots of wood. Medium sourness. Earthy. Lovely. No carbonation.

Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. 
superb sour, great beer

Pours deep hazy orange with a minimal white head that disappears quickly. Aroma is green apples, jam, some orange and apricots, yeast, funk, hay (both weat and dry). Taste is initially sour, with citrus and green apples, a slight vinegar tone, shortly after a more fruity, almost sweet tone of apricots before its getting subtle funky with barn and grass. Some oak tones. Ends dry. Zero to minimal carbo, medium body, texture is somewhat sticky and oily. Despite a lot of character and complexity, this is a very drinkable gueuze. Flawless!

Bought this one in Cali on my cross country road trip, felt like the right time to give it a go.


A - Pours clear golden yellow with a small film of white head, quickly dissipating down to nothing at all, leaving no lace on the sides of the glass. It was dead flat almost instantly.


S - Smells of woody oak barrel, earthen minerals, light lactic sourness, bit of tart fruit zest and the typical fonteinen barnyard funk. Smells pretty similar to the base beer.


T - Starts off with the strong oak barrel character and minerals quickly being joined by the fruit, sourness and fonteinen funk. Finish is woody with some mild funk, not lingering for very long after the finish. Tastes just like regular Doesjel with some extra barrel tossed in on top.


M - Medium body with low carbonation. Smooth, woody feel with very little sourness. This one is a bit all over the place. I like the flavor but the carb does it no favors.


O - Nothing overly amazing at the moment but it has potential for the future. The wood is pretty strong right now but it should round out with some time. I will have to get a few more of these and stash them away.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Complex, sour, very tart, a bit vinous, apple, pear, peach. Taste has a lemony tartness, then some apricot/peach with a bit of sweetness, lots of earthy quality.
Bottle from De Hopduvel. Orange/yellow colour, no foam. Light carbonation. Complex funky aroma of green apples and lemon. Very drinkable. Wonderfull beer.

Golden orange in color, almost no carbonation.... Aroma is pure horse blanket, as only the Belgians can truly do... Funk, citrus... Flavor is lemon zest, funk, earth, hints of spice on the finish... Lightly tart... Excellent

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beautiful grassy beer with a golden color. Sour and tardy taste, but balanced and not aggresive. A great beer.
Lovely tart smell, funky luscious yeastiness, hazy amber colour, no head. Lovely, tartness, big acidity, low sweetness, low bitterness, great. Medium body, soft carbonation, tart finish. Just great!

Flaska från systembolaget. Orangefärgad vätska. I Stort sätt inget skum. Doft av fat citron persika och druva. Syrlig smak av äpple citron och apelsin. Kolsyrehalten är minimal. Skön syra med strävhet i gom.

Thanks to my buddy Caleb for shipping me a bunch of these. 

Poured into an old style 3 Fonteinen gueze tumbler. Served at cellar temperature. Golden to bronze in color and pretty clear. Huge white head resembling sea foam. Scents of well water, minerals, funk, lemon, hay. Smooth on the palate. Refreshing and easy going. Mild funkiness and pucker. Light carbonation. A quaffable offering from Armand. Delicious as expected.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle. 
Aroma has a light acidity with some lactic and faint acetic character. Light citrus and medium light oak. Moderately strong barnyard funk with horse blanket and herbal, earthiness very prevalent. 
Pours a cloudy, golden orange with some light brown highlights. Faint white head that lingers on the edges. No lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor has a moderate acidity with mostly lactic and citrus but a faint acetic character; nice complexity. Medium light oak notes and tannins. Moderate funky, barnyard notes of horse blanket, soil, hay and herbal character. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with faint carbonation; a little more carbonation than expected but mostly still. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a really nice beer with a ton of complex barnyard and acidity. The acidity is fairly soft though and not bright and in your face. Very earthy and herbal.

Golden brown. Minor level of bubbles. Smells like grape skins and muscadimes with shoe polish. Quote sweet taste. Peach is very heavy. Sweet and muscadine peach fuzz chalky and talky. Obviously flat. Very good
Overall: Brett, balance, complexity.Note: Bottle 375 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2014-04-26.

Pours a deep golden color with a finger of gaseous foam that fizzes off quickly. Musty basement, mushroom, watermelon rind, horseblanket and hints of citrus rind, beeswax, wet oak, sour lemon and some bitter dusty grass.

Bottle @ redlight redlight. Funk and horse blanket on the nose with acidic citrus aromas. Pours golden blond with no head and very little carbonation as the label describes. Bitter citrus upfront with hints of sweetness following with a very dry funk and acidic finish. Excellent!
Bottle at De Grote Nacht van Dorst 2014. Almost clear golden. Funky lemony aromas, sharp lemony and woody flavours. Great.

Bottle (375 ml). Hazy dark golden/orange with no head and no lacing. Aroma is extremely complex with more oak than usual 3F gueuze along with loads of barnyard, lemon, fruity notes and herbal presence. Taste is very harmonious despite the absence of carbonation. Awesome complexity, tons of barnyard, moderate sourness, oak, lemon, hay, leather and nice herbalness. Medium body. No carbonation, completely flat. Dry finish. Its less explosive, more rounded and mature (maybe because of 4 year lambic part in it) than regular 3F Oude Geuze. Very tasty and quite refreshing despite the lack of carbonation. Loved it!

375ml bottle in a teku. Pours hazy copper with hardly any head. Aroma of sourness/funkiness, light oak, hints of light fruits, pale and caramel malts, and light spices. Flavor the same with a nice blend of the funky and sour notes. Average texture except not a lot of carbonation. A good beer.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2014 Bottle from Tipples. A bunch of these randomly showed up on the shelf and I guess I was there at the right time. $21.99 for this 375 ml bottle dated Apr 13, 2012. Poured to a wine glass Orange gold colored with essentially no head. Just a few bubbles. A dusty bit to start the aroma, oak, a tad of a mint character, sweet sugars, and a bit of fruit. Flavor is very sour, almost juicy with a dry finish, lots of puckering here, some sweet sugars, fruit, lingering oak, very acidic. Mouthfeel is full bodied with low carbonation and a dry finish. Reminds me of an Unblended lambic with a bit more bubbly. Good stuff, very smooth, but I think I like the regular version better.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2015 Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a small off-white head. Aroma of barnyard, horse blanket caramel, wood notes and vinegar. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carb. A great Lambic.
Bottle @ ZZT9 shared by martinus. Clear golden colour with no head. Smells slightly rubbery, sourish, dusty. Tastes sourish and some lemon. Medium body, soft carbo.
375 ml bottle. April 13 2002 date on bottle. Pours lovely. Big apple tart bite. Apples and light vinegar. Peach finish. That lingering tartness that sits like a pillow in the mouth. Awesome.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 April 2012 bottle. Pours hazy bright orange with rapidly settling white head, no lace. Aroma is strong funky, barnyard, horse blanket, tart, oaky, musty, cheese. Flavor is moderately tart, building slightly, oaky, vinegar, mildly fruity, with a lingering buttery oak, tart finish. Soft carbonation, medium body, dry and astringent finish.

Bottle at a hotelroom in Copenhagen, the start of our trip to San Diego. Almost clear golden beer with a small white head. Sourish horse blanket aroma, rubber, grapefruit, citrus, tart, oaky, lemon, some dandelions, floral, grassy notes. Sour citrus flavor, grapefruit, rubber, horse blanket, tart, funky, grapefruit notes, dandelions, hay, apples, some leather. Extremely drinkable beer, very nice.
UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 Complete horseblanket. Nearly flat. Mild sourness. Funky. Very well balanced and well done. Slight sweetness on the back end. Almost a wine like quality.
Bottled @ ZZT 9, small sample. Slight hazy golden color, short head. Aroma of citric and lactic acid, bit horseblanket. Medium sour in taste, slight sweetness left. Lovely balance.

Bottle @ ZZT 9 thanks to Martinus. Clear golden color, no head. Aroma has citrus and a touch of white wine, slightly a touch of rubber. Taste has a touch of sour and influence of white wine. Quite dry. Not sharp at all, quite soft. Very nice indeed, but less sour than I head expected. Lovely though.
Pours a golden slightly unclear beer with a good white head. Smells heavy sour. Tastes mild sour. Very nice sweet finish. Average carbo, thin body and a sticky texture. Nice but could be more sour.

Tasted on 2/7/14 from a corked and caged bottle at the Friday night tasting at RBWG Asheville, thanks to ygtbsm94 for sharing. Pours clear golden with an average white head that slowly disappears altogether. The nose is classic 3F, with plenty of sour funk, vinous tart lemon, and that signature hint of burnt rubber I associate with 3F. The flavor is not quite as intense as expected, very balanced, same sour funk and vinous lemon with a hint of vanilla oak. The body is medium with grippy tannin, average carbonation, and a long sour, funky finish.

4/13/2012 bottle consumed 3/15/2014. pours still. rustic earthy lemon lime. bright. leathery musty old woodsy forest floor funk. pleasant dusty cowhide. moderate to heavy lemony sourness. wet oak. quite dry. no carbonation. interesting, tasty. signature drie fonteinen funk. pretty good. perhaps apples and oranges, but prefered golden blend by a fair measure.
Bottle, thanks Tim. Pale golden with white head. Nice big sharp funky aroma. Taste is a bit more mellow, plenty of 3f funk. Quite oily with low carb and low sourness. Tasty
Pours hazy amber golden with minimal head. Aroma is funky fruity apples barrel. Flavor is astringent dry fruity cellar funky.

Well this beer was interesting. A little carbonation even tough it's supposed to be still. A huge horse blanket aroma. Taste is a 3fonteimen vintage geuze like taste a bit caramel even tough is totally dry. Good but not the greatest

Bottle shared at the RBWG Friday night bottle share at Downtown Inn. Pours a hazy, pale gold color. Notes of oak, sweat, salt, lemon, grapes, spices, grapefruit, and melon. Light-bodied, with low carbonation and a dry, spicy mouthfeel. Really nice, but not up to the standard of other 3F offerings.

[ Bottle ][ RBWG Afterparty2 ][ 375mL ][ Globe ][ Tasting ][ 2/7/14 ]
>> Thank you ygtbsm94 for the share! Pours a flatter clear golden. Nose is squashy, cantaloupe, huge ruby red grapefruit, powerful and bright 3F house leathery yeast. Taste is bright grapefruit peel, salty, bitter peel, lightly sour but more just ruby red grapefruit juice. Quenching, nicely bitter balanced palate. Really nice.
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with white head. Nose and taste of splintered wood, lemon, horsey hay,  musk, old citrus and funky oak. Medium body.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small fast disappearing white head. Has a fruity sour tart funky aroma. Fruity sour tart funky citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart funky finish.

Bottle at RBWG 2014, thanks! Pours a hazy gold with no head whatsoever. Aroma has a great funky and sour fruit combination with a bit of earthiness backing. Flavor starts slightly mild with a growing tartness with a light barnyard funk.
Bottle (375 ml) from Beergium. Shady deep golden, no head. Cidery and fruity aroma with notes of grapefruit, some wood, and some mild funk. Medium bodied, low carbonation. Dry with firm acidity.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #60. Bottled shared by Ygtbsm94 at the Friday Night Downtown Inn Bottle Share. Pours a hazy pale yellow color with a thin white head. Aroma of tart citrus, funk, earth, must, pepper and earth. Taste is earthy, musty citrus. Medium bodied, slight lingering tartness.

Small taste from a 375ml bottle. I think it had a green 3 on the label. Hazy golden orange color. Thin off white head. Medium body. Soft lighter carbonation. Very nice bigger sour taste to this, a light sweet. Good big oaky barrely lightly funky aroma. Good subtle complexity. Very nice oaky tart funky geuze. Awesome, sour, tart funky spicy geuze. Definitely the best sour Ive had all weekend. Awesome stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 Bottle @ RBWG Fart Share (and again later @ home). Pours a murky yellow appearance with a white head. Cheesy, tart lemon, big oaky, vanilla, funky, sweet socks, earthy aroma. Fairly sour but not like Golden Blend. Lots of oak. Big lemon, lactic goodness. Hay / straw dryness. Very dry. Carbonation is a bit dull. Pretty dang good but I prefer the normal Oude Geuze more.
Bottle to snifter (shared at RBWG). Looks good; s slightly cloudy gold with white lacing. Smells and tastes like a good but not great geuze. Still, great beer.

Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy gold with small frothy white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is a strong funk, oak, and fruit. Medium mouthfeel with strong funk with fruit and light dry finish. Very good.
Funk, spannmål och andra härligheter i doften. Låg ättika. Läsk! laddade för surt, men det var läsk. nice. Bra pausöl i tung provning. Får lite Zomer-vibbar.
37,5cl Bottle @ 3 Fonteinen. Pours hazy Golden With a bubbly white head. Nose is funk, cellar and barnyard. Dry and crisp flavor With barnyard, funk, lemon and citrus up front. Tasty and awesome.

Bottle at the pre Bamberg tune up in the Sham, from Etre Gourmet, 23/01/14.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white head that clears to spotting.
Nose is earthy, touch of dung, tangy fruits, orange peel, lemon rind, dank straw, light must.
Taste comprises bitter orange, straw, quite clean tasting for a gueuze, musty, dank straw, light piss, dry rot.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp close.
Solid stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
18/I/14 - 37.5cl bottle @ RBBWG III, my place - BB: n/a (2014-114) Thanks to Tinus for sharing the bottle!
Clear golden coloured beer, no head. Aroma: YES! Thats the good stuff were looking for! Very nice and typical 3F bretta notes, lemony, bit sour and funky. Well, you know how we always lack the vocabulary to describe good lambics... MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: little bitter, lemon peel, grapefruit, bit of spices, peppery touch, soft bitterness, hoppy touch. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, bit metallic, funky, sour touch. Dont like the bitter element in the beer.

23rd January 2014Pre Bamberg bash tasting at Colins house with Mr Bois and James. Big thanks to uncle Colin. Very hazy gold beer, small bubbly white head. Palate is light and crisp. Minerals. Nice mellow to mediuk fruity sourness. Light wood. Finishes minerally crisp. Hugely drinkable. Lovely.

37.5cl bouteille @ RBBWG III, thanks Tinus. 
Dorée, col blanc fin.
Arôme de grains et de suite de belles effluves de lambic, bouquet boisé, étable, cuir qcq notes dépices.
Palais est légèrement suret, pointe de fruité et citronné aigre. Sorte de feuilles vertes et fleuri avec le caractère typique de lambic. Le tout est très sec avec des notes poussiéreuses. Reste solide au fini et un cran au dessus de la 3F geuze habituelle.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 14.01.2014, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Small bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is old rope, citrus peel, oak, grapefruit, mild vinegar, sorrel, hints of sour socks. Taste is mild and balanced, sorrel, citrus peel, grass, oak, grapefruit, hay. Nice acidity, slightly dry mouthfeel, soft carbonation, almost a little "sweet" finish. Very nice.

Light pop of the cork, hazy golden-orange body, medium to thin off-white head, spotty lacing. Must and light funk dominate both the flavor and aroma profiles, light citrus and oak comes through in the flavor. Medium bodied, gentle carbonation, modest acidity, nice finish.

Bottle .. thanks Josh for sharing. Poured a hazy golden color with a small sized head. Some funkiness, vanilla, citrus, fruity, woody, and apples. Lighter tart finish. Softer all the way around, but very enjoyable and drinkable.

Bottle, shared at the brewery. Pours a hazy, darker golden beer without any head. Aroma is massive barnyard funk, some horse blanket, slight pepper and fruityness. Flavor is tart, sour fruit and has a very, very dry mouthfeel. Soft carbonation going on, medium long, tart finish. Easy drinkable.

Bottle at home from Etre. It pours hazy golden-orange with a touch of fizz. The nose is soft, woody, lemon, tangerine, hint of vanilla, earth and barnyard. The taste is smooth, tart apple, lemon sherbet, limeade, wet wood, damp leaves, mild acidity, barnyard, floral notes and just a touch of bitterness with a dry, tart finish. Medium body and a hint of carbonation. Soft and well-rounded, yet has a great depth to it. Plenty of subtle nuances of flavours. The drinkablity is pretty amazing. Great stuff.

375 ml at home. Since 1 week for sale. Pours clear light golden with no head, just an adhesive circle against the edges. #3100 beer. # 60 Geuze. #25 3 Fonteinen beer. Sampled @ the brewery shop, courtesy of Armand himself. Thx! 375 ml. bottle @ home. Picked up from the same shop. Corked & caged as usual with the top of the bottle covered with foil much like bottles of Cava. The foil is black silver as far as colours go. Bottled on 13/04/2012 this bottle has already been around for some 20 months, a sufficient age for consumption to begin I would say. It pours a candy sugar orange, a shade darker than you would expect. Hazier as well than you would expect, I am the one to blame for that. As I was told at the shop you are advised to let this one rest upright for 3 days prior to drinking in order for all residues to sufficiently settle down. If you are a good boy unlike me and you follow this advice you should obtain a much clearer beer than I did. Once poured into my 3 Fonteinen "wine" glass a small and white head does form but only for a brief second as it quickly collapses to a tiny island in the middle of your glass. Some minor lacing does remain afterwards for some time like its ghost coming back to haunt you. Nose is all soft and musty like damned earth in a mushroom cave. Sourdough bread and a freshly opened pack of champignons, though not the mushrooms themselves so much as the earth that is stuck to them. Hay and white pepper. Mellow and round as well something ancient to it, society minus humans style. Taste is mellow mandarin juice mixed with candy sugar, this slides down just like water. So incredibly juicy and fruity and the finish carries old rotting wooden door in the middle of the forest type of bitterness. Pungent pepper and faint hay go hand in hand plus a dash of the good old champignon cave earth. Flat and easier to drink than water. Some minor carbonation is present right after opening, luckily it vanishes quickly all the same. I have had some variable experiences with 3F Doesjels with some of them underperforming and others blowing me away. This one is no different, the one I had at the store was nice but felt a bit like ancient lambic that has lost some of its prowess and didnt feel like worthy of continues nocturnal visitations. The bottle that I got at home was stellar so what give here? Is all of this just a lottery and you have to just hope that you win the jackpot? Or did the fact that I drank mine at home with the sediment poured in (once again, against advice, sorry) & the fact that I drank mine quite cold, much colder than most would dare I am willing to bet? This could be, the striking contrast in flavours felt more than a bit too much to suggest those being the reasons. The one I had at home drank like water or tea in my case or mater (). I am willing to be that if you age this one for many years more, say six or seven that it will taste similar to how Blauw tasted like when I had it not that terribly long ago. Obviously you are gambling here, get a bottle like the one I had at the store and you will totally miss the mark. The Doesjel comes and goes as (s)he or it pleases. And oh yeah, 4.6 for the one at the store and a high 4.8 for the one at home. 4.7 on average.
